node.title: Dozens of paua poachers claim innocence after being caught at South Island reserve
node.description: Around 50 people in about an hour have been spotted trying to get pƒÅua from a South Island reserve where it is illegal to take them.
node.content: ["Around 50 people in about an hour have been spotted trying to get p\u0101ua from a South Island reserve where it is illegal to take them.", "The Department of Conservation is concerned about a sudden rise in poaching from the Hikurangi Marine Reserve near Kaik\u014dura.", "Senior marine ranger Dr Jody Weir said that during a visit to the site yesterday, she found many people unwittingly about to break the law.", "\"I've had over 90 interactions with people in just over an hour in the marine reserve and I'd say about half of those were looking for a place so they could take p\u0101ua.\"", "People seemed genuinely surprised they cannot take the p\u0101ua, despite lots of signs carrying warnings, she said.", "\"There are huge signs that are visible both from the sea, so that if you're in a boat you can see the big yellow triangles on either end of the shore of the marine reserve section.\"", "She said regardless of intention, people's actions may damage the reserve beyond repair, and everyone needs to pull together before it becomes a biodiversity catastrophe.", "Penalties for taking marine life from a reserve include on-the-spot fines of up to $600 and if the case is prosecuted the penalties include three months in prison.", "RNZ", "\u00a0"]
